p: Experiments were performed with five replicates. Data were subjected to one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) using SPSS statistics 22 software. Tukey’s post hoc test was used when variances remained homogeneous (Levene’s test) and T3 Dunnett’s post hoc test was employed if not, assuming equal variances. Differences were considered to be significant at p ≤ 0.05.
